channel.title: Whirlwind Wheelchair
channel.description: A non-profit social enterprise dedicated to improving the lives of people with disabilities in the developing world while also promoting sustainable local economic development

item.title: Congratulations to all the WINNERS of the RoughRider 2017 Best Video & Story Contest!
item.dc:creator: Israel Curtis
item.category: Winners of the RoughRider Photo/ Video Contest

item.content:encoded:
Read about the RoughRider rough-terrain Wheelchair that gets people off the pavement and out into the roads less traveled. Our riders write us from national parks, beaches and even the jungles of the Philippines!

When our wheelchairs allow someone to gain a greater sense of independence and freedom, we know that we need to keep working and pushing forward to design wheelchairs giving greater freedom and independence through mobility for all!

Eric Logan – WINNER of the ROUGHRIDER BEST PHOTO CONTEST!
Eric’s photo was taken at Surigao del Norte in the Philippines. He won $50 USD OR free push handle extenders for every photo that we used in 2017 and 2018!

Here is what Eric had to say about his RoughRider:

Dear RoughRider,

I’m Eric Logan and I love your product! My photo was taken in Surigao del Norte, Philippine on the island of Mindanao.  That’s where I have used it for everything from a marathon to daily exercise or just getting around where there is no sidewalk.  I like challenging myself, so I look for the biggest hill, or mountain and try to go up and down it several times.  I have used this chair on the ocean bottom (really), where my wife family lives in Surigao. It bumps up against the China Sea, and at low tide, in some places, you can literally walk on the sea floor. You guys have a great chair and really half the world that needs a chair could really use one.

Thanks a lot for creating it!

Eric Logan 

Alex Neupauer – WINNER of the ROUGHRIDER BEST PHOTO CONTEST!
Alex’s photo was taken at Arches National Park in Utah, USA. He won $50 USD PLUS free push handle extenders for the best photo in a US or Canadian state, provincial or national park.

Caitlin Myers – WINNER of the ROUGHRIDER BEST PHOTO CONTEST!
Caitlin’s photo was taken at Thingvellir National Park in Iceland. She won $200 USD for the best testimonial that was published in 2017 PLUS we donated a RoughRider in her name, manufactured by our partners in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam to a wheelchair rider in need in that country. In addition, she received a $200 discount on the purchase of a new RoughRider or future product offered.


Chris Daly– WINNER of the ROUGHRIDER BEST PHOTO CONTEST!
Chris’ photo was taken at Rocky Mountain National Park in Colorado, USA. She won $50 USD OR free push handle extenders for every photo that we used in 2017 or that will be used in 2018!


Evan Swarth – WINNER of the ROUGHRIDER BEST VIDEO CONTEST!
Evan’s video was taken at Joshua Tree National Park in California, USA. She won $200 USD for best video PLUS we will be making a donation of a RoughRider wheelchair in her name, manufactured by our partners in Tbilisi, Georgia to a wheelchair rider in need there in addition to a $200 discount on the purchase of a new RoughRider or any of our future products offered!
